content.description: Cool pockets and funky pinches. Start about 5 feet left of the arete at a great left hand pocket and mediocre right hand pocket. Up through pockets to blocks near the lip. The business ends at about the 8 foot mark. Top out on tall but easy slab.
content.protection: Three to four pads to cover the rocks in the landing plus a spotter. Downclimb the east side of the north face.

content.description: Start as for Mechanical Mannequin but move right to a sharp pocket, match the pocket, then under cling it, and then figure out a way to go up to the sloper using two small pocket-bumps.
content.protection: The landing is bad, with a tailbone-breaker right underneath the route. Multiple pads recommended and a good spot.

content.description: Another overhanging fin. Starting from a sit go past a bulge and continue up the arete to gain the slab above. Top out on easy climbing. Downclimb east end of north face.
Start with a good left hand pocket/jug, and right in a three-finger pocket, cross to a cobble pinch. Move through crosses on jugs and up the crack-like-stuff.
content.protection: Pads, the landing is pretty good.
content.location: Starts on two pockets about 8 feet right of the down climb.

content.description: Use crimps and ledges to make your way up to jugs about half way up. Then work through pockets to the top. Crux is getting to the jugs down low. As always, be mindful of loose rock.
content.location: Four feet to the left of Pyrrhuloxia.

content.description: Another large block with potential all the way around. The uphill side is about 50 feet across, gently overhanging about 10 feet high and always shaded. The west side is bulgy with interesting holds.
